title: Godot Engine Official
description: Godot is a 2D and 3D free and open source game engine developed by a community of contributors. It provides a huge set of common tools, so you can just focus on making your game without reinventing the wheel.

items.title: Godot Showcase - Usagi Shima
items.description: A relaxing, idle bunny collecting game made by Jess, a solo indie developer
items.dc:creator: Emi

items.title: gamescom, here we go!
items.description: Join us next week at the Godot booth during gamescom in Cologne from Wednesday the 23rd, to Friday the 25th. Don't miss the chance to say hello to the Godot team!
items.dc:creator: Emi

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 3.6 beta 3
items.description: Slowly but surely, Godot 3.6 is shaping up to be a great release. This third snapshot adds long awaited 2D physics interpolation, and another great optimization with 2D hierarchical culling.
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 dev 3
items.description: One month into the release cycle for Godot 4.2, things are well under way. This third dev snapshot features a lot of improvements to C# and rendering.
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: Godot Conference 2023: Call for Participations
items.description: Looking to share your expertise through a talk or workshop? Join us and make this an event to remember!
items.dc:creator: Julian Murgia

items.title: Godot Rendering Priorities: July 2023
items.description: The Godot rendering team continues to focus on stability, performance and usability
items.dc:creator: Clay John

items.title: Maintenance release: Godot 4.0.4
items.description: A fresh pack of stability and documentation improvements for teams still using Godot 4.0 is officially out!
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 dev 2
items.description: Closing the first month of development of Godot 4.2, the second development snapshot includes both smaller improvements and bigger features.
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

items.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.0.4 RC 1
items.description: A new batch of backported fixes for Godot 4.0 is ready for testing! Even if you aren't able to move to Godot 4.1 just yet, we can't leave you without support and improvements.
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 dev 1
items.description: We are ready to share the first batch of improvements coming to Godot 4.2 later this year with the release of the first dev snapshot!
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

items.title: Join us at the Godot Conference 2023!
items.description: We are happy to announce that we are going to be hosting the 2023 GodotCon in Munich, Germany.
items.dc:creator: Emi

items.title: Maintenance release: Godot 4.1.1
items.description: Hot on the heels of its parent release, here's Godot 4.1.1 — the first maintenance release of the 4.1 branch, with more stability and workflow improvements.
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

items.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.1.1 RC 1
items.description: The first round of bugfixes and usability improvements for Godot 4.1 is ready for your consideration!
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

items.title: Godot Funding Breakdown & Hiring Process
items.description: This article aims to shed light on the current status of Godot's funding, hiring, and our plans for sustainable funding long term.
items.dc:creator: Godot Foundation

items.title: Godot 4.1 is here, smoother, more reliable, and with plenty of new features
items.description: Four months after the release of Godot 4.0, we are excited to bring you Godot 4.1 — an update with a focus on stability, performance, and polish.
items.dc:creator: Godot contributors

items.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.1 RC 3
items.description: A few more critical regressions were fixed, and the milestone is now 100% complete. Let's confirm that 4.1 is ready with a (final?) RC.
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.1 RC 2
items.description: A few more regressions were fixed, and we should now be ready for the Godot 4.1 release. Help us confirm that by testing RC 2!
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.1 RC 1
items.description: After 4 months of development, Godot 4.1 is only days away. To make sure it doesn't miss the mark, here's the first release candidate for your testing!
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

items.title: Godot community poll 2023
items.description: It's this time of the year! Godot Community Poll 2023 is now out!
items.dc:creator: Clay John

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.1 beta 3
items.description: We are getting confident in the state of Godot 4.1! To wrap things up here's the last beta release, bringing more fixes to reported issues.
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

items.title: Godot at BIG Festival 2023
items.description: Godot will have a booth and a talk at BIG Festival 2023, which takes place in São Paulo, Brazil from June 28th to July 2nd
items.dc:creator: George Marques

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.1 beta 2
items.description: Continuing on our planned schedule for Godot 4.1, we're advancing through the beta phase and getting ready for a stable release in early July.
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.1 beta 1
items.description: Switching gears into the bug-fixing mode, here's the first beta of Godot 4.1, and a great opportunity to try the new version of the engine ahead of the official release.
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.1 dev 4
items.description: This snapshot signifies that Godot 4.1 is now in feature freeze and will only receive bug fixes going forward. Enjoy this final package of new features and enhancements and give them a good shake!
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov
